resources.string:
A spunky, chubby teenager with gelled hair shot to fame after
leading India to glory in the Under-19 World
Cup at Kuala Lumpur in early 2008. In an Indian team filled with saint-like
icons worthy of their own hagiographies, Virat Kohli,
with his most un-Indian, bad-boy intensity, would clearly be an outcast.

Languid and easy on the eye, Rohit Sharma owned all the
shots in the book when he emerged from the Mumbai
suburbs as heir apparent to the Indian batting greats of the 2000s. It took him time and persistence,
but by the 2010s he had become a colossus in white-ball cricket, and the man in charge of perhaps the most
formidable league team in the first age of T20.
